Issues.Title: Accessibility: Fixing ItemStatus property in programmatically sorted DataGridView
Issues.Body: Fixes #1054.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Accessibility: Fixing ItemStatus property in programmatically sorted DataGridView" (#1055)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: Programmatically sorted DataGridView does not expose the current sort order and column in ItemStatus property
Issues.Body:
Ported bug 792776.
Steps to reproduce in simple WinForms test app:

1. Create a WinForms app with the DataGridView control with column that is configured to use programmatic sort.​
2. Sort the DataGridView by the column with programmatic sort method.​
3. Use the Inspect SDK tool to find the current sort order through UIA.​


**Result:** Sort column and order isn't exposed in ItemStatus property of the DataGridView accessible object in Inspect.​
**Expected:** ItemStatus property should provide the column by which the DataGridView is sorted and sort order, eg. "Sorted (Ascending)"
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Accessibility: Programmatically sorted DataGridView does not expose the current sort order and column in ItemStatus property" (#1054)

Issues.Title: [Loc]The description text is not showing correctly in MultilineStringEditor drop down.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview6-012122 from Master branch
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
The description text is not showing correctly in MultilineStringEditor drop down.

Issues | Description | Affected language
-- | -- | --
Issue#1 | Description text is not showing in MultilineStringEditor drop down. | TRK, CSY, JPN,   FRA, KOR, PTB,PLK, DEU,
Issue#2 | 2 description sentences should be shown in 2 lines, need to wrap. | CHS, CHT, RUS,   ITA, ESN

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
**Issue#1**: Description text is not showing in MultilineStringEditor drop down. 
![Core](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/58677215-ae55d980-838d-11e9-8e2a-0d8960b1aa9c.PNG)
**Issue#2**: 2 description sentences doesn't wrap.
![222](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/58677405-64b9be80-838e-11e9-80c7-a02e3b3918d7.png)

**Expected behavior:**
Description text should be show in MultilineStringEditor drop down, and 2 description sentences should be wrap.
![Fra](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/58677224-b44bba80-838d-11e9-8676-b5e8bb53fd4b.PNG)

**Minimal repro:**
1.Install latest VS & .NET Core 3.0 on loc machine, then open the attached app.
[WindowsFormsApp2.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3239429/WindowsFormsApp2.zip)
2.Run it and open the MultilineStringEditor drop down of **Text** property.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Loc]The description text is not showing correctly in MultilineStringEditor drop down." (#1076)

Issues.Title: Screen.AllScreens return different size
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes/No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**  

 Screen.AllScreens return different size between framework and netcore ,system DPI 125%  

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
  
 net core
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80653/58603529-b1849300-82c3-11e9-8afc-7dee8439d1fc.png)  
  
**Expected behavior:**
 framework 4.7.2
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80653/58603550-c9f4ad80-82c3-11e9-8143-64efed9d4c22.png)  
  
**Minimal repro:**
 https://github.com/giantapp-libraries/LiveWallpaperEngine/blob/master/LiveWallpaperEngine/LiveWallpaperEngineManager.cs

Line:56

Issues.Title: An exception dialog appeared after calling the Clipbpard.SetImage() method
Issues.Body:
**OS:** RS4 X64
**VS:** Visual Studio 2019 Version 16.2.0 Preview 1.0 [28921.214.d16.2]
**.NET SDK:** .NET Core 3.0 3.0.100-preview6-012102 from master branch
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**More info:** 
The issue also can reproduce when setting the image's format is "emf, gif, ico".

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Create a Winforms .Net Core application by command: 
2. Adding the below code in the form1.cs file;
`using System.Drawing.Imaging;     Image actual = null; Image expected = Image.FromFile(@"D:\Test.png"); Clipboard.SetImage(expected);  actual = Clipboard.GetImage();`
3. Debugging the "Clipboard.SetImage(expected)" method.

**Actual:**
When debugging to Clipboard.SetImage(expected); method, an exception dialog appeared.
![Actual](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325459/58543736-9b7ac200-8232-11e9-9645-12d5e1d38189.PNG)

**Expected:**
There no exception appeared.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "An exception dialog appeared after calling the Clipbpard.SetImage() method" (#1062)

Issues.Title: An exception pops up when using the method GetData(Type format) of IDataObject
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .NET Core 3.0.100-preview6-012101 from master branch
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create a Winforms .Net Core application.
2. Write code to Form1.cs.
 IDataObject o = Clipboard.GetDataObject();
 string got = (String)o.GetData(typeof(String));
3. Build and run the application.

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
When debugging to _string got = (String)o.GetData(typeof(String))_, the exception pops up.
![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/58549157-7b043500-823d-11e9-951a-f4b49bc61fd0.PNG)

**Expected behavior:**
No exception pops up, application runs successfully.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "An exception pops up when using the method GetData(Type format) of IDataObject" (#1064)

Issues.Title: Sort glyph icon should be shown in DataGridView column header cell when programmatically sorted DataGridView
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .NET Core 3.0 3.0.100-preview6-012102 from master branch
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open this attached Core app, build and run it
[WindowsFormsApp6.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3231665/WindowsFormsApp6.zip)
2. Click "SortColumn1" or "SortColumn2" button to sort left DataGridView, which Columns' SortMode is "Programmatic"
3. Please notice corresponding sort Column header

**Actual behavior:** 
There is no sort glyph icon showing in Column header.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/58545679-98db8680-81b8-11e9-8d32-5c81cd557b88.png)

**Expected behavior:**
It should have sort glyph icon showing in Column header when sorting it, like sort DataGridView with "Automatic" SortMode setting.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/58545870-02f42b80-81b9-11e9-83eb-585045158583.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Sort glyph icon should be shown in DataGridView column header cell when programmatically sorted DataGridView" (#1063)

Issues.Title: An exception pops up when using the method System.Diagnostics.Process.Start() in the .NET Core 3.0 winforms application
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .NET Core 3.0.100-preview6-012101 from master branch
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Create a Winforms .Net Core application.
2. Write code to Form1.cs.
   System.Diagnostics.Process.Start("http://www.bing.com");
3. Build and run the application.

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
When debugging to _System.Diagnostics.Process.Start("http://www.bing.com")_, the exception pops up.
![Error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/58533671-b5f57100-821b-11e9-89ea-a7bf8aff7191.png)

**Call Stack:**
System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception
  HResult=0x80004005
  Message=The system cannot find the file specified.
  Source=System.Diagnostics.Process
  StackTrace:
   at System.Diagnostics.Process.StartWithCreateProcess(ProcessStartInfo startInfo)
   at System.Diagnostics.Process.Start()
   at System.Diagnostics.Process.Start(ProcessStartInfo startInfo)
   at System.Diagnostics.Process.Start(String fileName)
   at test1.Form1..ctor() in C:\Users\v-jiaol\Desktop\demo\test1\Form1.cs:line 18
   at test1.Program.Main() in C:\Users\v-jiaol\Desktop\demo\test1\Program.cs:line 19

**Expected behavior:**
No exception pops up, application runs successfully.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "An exception pops up when using the method System.Diagnostics.Process.Start() in the .NET Core 3.0 winforms application" (#1061)

Issues.Title: Winforms apps crash when using clipboard APIs
Issues.Body:
.NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview6-012099

Windows version: Win10

Does the bug reproduce also in Winforms for .NET Framework 4.8?: No

Problem description:
Using some of the Clipboard APIs, throw exceptions and cause application crashes.
E.g.
Clipboard.SetData(DataFormats.UnicodeText, "abc");

Actual behavior: 
Throws an ExecutionEngineException.

Expected behavior:
sets the data to the clipboard without issue

Minimal repro:
Clipboard.SetData(DataFormats.UnicodeText, "abc");

this issue was found in WPF as well, we've filed a coreclr issue as we believe that's where the root cause is.

https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/issues/24816
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/775
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Winforms apps crash when using clipboard APIs" (#1060)

Issues.Title: Fix ApiCompatBaseline.netcoreapp.txt
Issues.Body: Minimise the number of APIs missing. Some sort of tooling allowing false-negatives (i.e. APIs that actually do exist but are written in as not existing) to be notified would help!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fix ApiCompatBaseline.netcoreapp.txt " (#1059)
